location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 37: William Hornby, John Carnac and Daniel Draper at Bombay Castle, to John Beaumont, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter, received 1 February 1780, via the Ranger,John Beaumont, Resident at Bushire, is informed that Messieurs Banks and Bonniveaux and their packet have been captured by the Marassas, with whom the Company is now at war. The letter gives details of how copies of the packets may be obtained.
